label: AB8_tP18_136_a_2fi-001
title: $\alpha$'-V$_{8}$O Structure
comments:
(Villars, 2018) calls this $\beta$-V$_{8}$O, and refers to it as the room-temperature tetragonal structure.  They also refer to a room-temperature triclinic structure. 
 This is a supercell of the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cI2_229_a-001}{body-centered cubic ($A2$) lattice}, with periodic interstitial oxygen atoms at the octahedral sites.  In the real structure it is likely that there is considerable relaxation around the oxygen atoms.
